title: Tourist finds she's captured priceless moment in background of holiday snaps
text:

When a holidaymaker returned home from a two-week Italian road trip, she sat down with her family to proudly show them the memories from her travels.

Alycia Savard-Ouellet's packed schedule included visits to Florence, Naples and Pompeii, with the journey beginning and ending in Rome.

During her five-night stay in the capital city, she paid a visit to the world-famous Trevi Fountain, considered one of the most famous in the world and a hot spot for visitors.

As the 19-year-old whizzed through hundreds of images, she showed her loved ones images of her posing in front of the iconic landmark when her mum stopped her, spotting a magical moment in the background.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

In a snap of the science student looking at the floor in front of the railings at the fountain, a man can be seen holding out a ring to his partner and she clasps her hands to her mouth in surprise.

In the following photo, as Alycia turns to face the camera, the unknown woman can be seen jumping into the man's arms after seemingly saying yes to the proposal.

Alycia, from Canada, has now launched an online search to find the couple and to be able to share the romantic moment with them.

"It was really cute," she said. "Once I came back home, I was showing my pictures to my parents on the TV and I told them 'oh I remember, I was laughing because of the cute couple kissing'.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

"Then my mom went 'wait, go back to the picture before this one' and we noticed he looked like he was proposing.

"So I've decided to try and find them and share the pictures with them, because they are really cute and in the moment.

"It was amazing, I hope I can find them."

During her solo pizza-fuelled adventure, she visited the famous fountain three times, but on the first visit a stranger asked Alycia to take a photo of her.

(Image: Kennedy News and Media)

They got chatting and discovered they were both from Montréal before her new friend offered to take her photo too.

The pair very nearly missed the emotional moment when her designated photographer said 'wait, there's a couple kissing in the background of your pictures, we should move to take some without them'.

Alycia looked over her shoulder to have a look and laughed, with the stranger capturing it all on film.

Alycia described the trip as 'the best time of her life' and said: "The Trevi Fountain was on my list since it's one of the things you can't miss when in Rome.

"It's so lovely, I hope I can find them because they might want these really cute pictures."
description: Student Alycia is now trying to track down the couple to share the photos with them
